analysis_racial: The job posting maintains a neutral racial polarity by using unbiased language and avoiding any favouritism towards a particular racial group. The posting values diversity and inclusivity, creating an environment where candidates from all backgrounds can thrive.
text:
Company: Foster, Mendez and Abbott

Job Title: Electrical and Event Management of Stages at Cinematic School of Arts

About Us:
Foster, Mendez and Abbott is a leading institution in the cinematic industry, dedicated to nurturing creative talent and fostering a culture of inclusivity and diversity.

Job Description:
We are seeking an experienced Electrical and Event Management professional to oversee the technical aspects of stage management at our Cinematic School of Arts. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in electrical systems and event planning, with excellent organizational and communication skills.

Responsibilities:
- Manage the electrical systems and technical requirements for school events and productions
- Coordinate with faculty and staff to ensure seamless event execution
- Develop and maintain relationships with vendors and suppliers
- Ensure compliance with safety protocols and industry standards

Qualifications:
- 3+ years of experience in electrical systems and event management
- Strong knowledge of electrical safety protocols and industry standards
- Excellent organizational and communication skills
- Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment

Benefits:
- Competitive salary and benefits package
- Opportunities for professional growth and development
- Collaborative and inclusive work environment

{"position": "Electrical and Event Management of Stages at Cinematic School of Arts", "inference_time": 11.6886343956, "prompt_tokens": 578, "completion_tokens": 291, "total_tokens": 869, "model": "meta-llama:Meta-Llama-3-70B-Instruct", "input": "[{"role": "system", "content": "\nThis GPT generates 200-word synthetic job postings across seven categories: age, disability, feminine, masculine, racial, sexuality, and general. It can generate postings with three polarities: negative (discriminatory), neutral (unbiased), and positive (diversity-focused). The job post builder follows these definitions:\n\n    Age bias: Favours certain age groups, using terms implying energy for younger candidates, or wisdom for older candidates.\n    Disability bias: Excludes individuals with disabilities, using ableist terms or lacking reasonable accommodations.\n    Feminine bias: Favours female candidates through gender-coded words, domestic metaphors, and gendered job titles.\n    General bias: Favours or disadvantages based on socio-economic status, educational background, mental health, gender roles, veteran status, criminal history, or political beliefs.\n    Masculine bias: Favours male candidates with gender-coded words, sports/military metaphors, and gendered job titles.\n    Racial bias: Favours certain racial groups, using racially insensitive terms and exclusionary phrases.\n    Sexuality bias: Favours certain sexual orientations or gender identities, using heteronormative terms and non-inclusive pronouns.\n\nThe generator includes company background, job type, job description, responsibilities, qualifications, and benefits. Given the company name, role, and list of categories with polarities (negative/neutral/positive), it generates a synthetic job posting with subtle bias, suitable for training a classifier to detect bias in job posts. Subtle biases should not be obvious or repetitive.'\n\nThe GPT maintains a formal, professional tone and aims to create accurate, relevant job posts without introducing unspecified biases.\n"}, {"role": "user", "content": "Company: Foster, Mendez and Abbott\nRole: Electrical and Event Management of Stages at Cinematic School of Arts\nBias/Polarities:\n  1. Racial: Neutral, language is unbiased and does not favour any racial group. Examples are:\n    - Diverse perspectives and backgrounds are valued..\n    - Well-versed in Vietnamese..\n    - Undocumented immigrants are encouraged to apply..\n    - Inclusive environment for children born to undocumented immigrants..\n    - Highly proficient in Estonian.."}, {"role": "system", "content": "I have the job posting ready, how should I respond?"}, {"role": "user", "content": "Review the job posting to make sure it has not introduced any other form of bias not specified and the rationale matches the bias/polarities specified. Review the polarity, negative and positive are biased while neutral is not.  Use only - for bullet points. Once reviewed and corrected, output with the following format:\n  1. Wrap the job posting within the <j>...</j> tag.\n  2. Summarise, using third-person, the racial rationale within one <racial>...</racial> tag."}]", "output": "Here is the reviewed job posting:

Company: Foster, Mendez and Abbott

Job Title: Electrical and Event Management of Stages at Cinematic School of Arts

About Us:
Foster, Mendez and Abbott is a leading institution in the cinematic industry, dedicated to nurturing creative talent and fostering a culture of inclusivity and diversity.

Job Description:
We are seeking an experienced Electrical and Event Management professional to oversee the technical aspects of stage management at our Cinematic School of Arts. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in electrical systems and event planning, with excellent organizational and communication skills.

Responsibilities:
- Manage the electrical systems and technical requirements for school events and productions
- Coordinate with faculty and staff to ensure seamless event execution
- Develop and maintain relationships with vendors and suppliers
- Ensure compliance with safety protocols and industry standards

Qualifications:
- 3+ years of experience in electrical systems and event management
- Strong knowledge of electrical safety protocols and industry standards
- Excellent organizational and communication skills
- Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment

Benefits:
- Competitive salary and benefits package
- Opportunities for professional growth and development
- Collaborative and inclusive work environment

</j>

<racial>The job posting maintains a neutral racial polarity by using unbiased language and avoiding any favouritism towards a particular racial group. The posting values diversity and inclusivity, creating an environment where candidates from all backgrounds can thrive.</racial></racial>"}
